item.description:
Ok, more details on the race for next Saturday. This, from the Race Director (?):

"Photographers are always welcome. The only thing we would ask is that you stand off the trail a few feet so that dogs won't get spooked. Some are prone to that. The other thing that I would ask, is that please encourage folks to share their photos because drivers seldom get to view their teams in action. Have fun. I think you will find the race site to be very photogenic."

We will leave from the parking lot across from the IOKA theater in Exeter, NH at 6 a.m. sharp. Our timing is to be there before the 8:30 drivers meeting. For more information about this event, check out: www.nesdc.org

See you Saturday ~

Cynthia



(Cynthia from the Seacoast Photographers group is managing this event. Details will be updated here as well for CAPE group members who are interested in this great photo opportunity.)

Ever see a dog sled race? Me neither.

Ever want to go to one and photograph? Me too.

Ok, so here's the deal. Saturday, January 29 (as long as there is snow), Tamworth NH is hosting a Sprint and Skijor Sled Dog event. The purse is $3,000.

The day begins at at 7:30 a.m. when drivers pick up their bibs; at 8:30 there is a drivers meeting and at 9 a.m. the Skijoring begins (sort of like, "let the fun begin"). Rankings include Dog Junior, Dog Pro, and Open categories. I have emailed the contact person - he said photographers are welcome.

I will email him closer to the date to let him know how many of us to expect.

Driving time is about 2 hours so I would plan on leaving Exeter at 6 a.m.

Meeting place: Downtown Exeter NH parking lot across the street from IOKA Theater at 6 a.m. - January 29.
item.name: Tamworth Dog Sled Races
